messages.title: Enough is Enough!
messages.content: Labour still says the NHS in East Lancashire is perfect. Local people say 'Bring back the A&E – and save the children’s ward.'

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Afzal is working closely with the Liberal Democrat Councillors in Colne to make sure the proposed new Health Centre is built in the town. The health authority already owns the land at the bottom of Marlview and Craddock Road.

mentions.candidate: Afzal Anwar chained himself to the railings at Burnley General Hospital for ten hours to protest against closing plans for the children's ward.

issues.health: Afzal is working on the Colne Health Care Campaign and has organized a petition which already has hundreds of signatures. He states that 'The greatest health problem in Lancashire, including chest disease, and poor heart mortality, which means more premature deaths than in the eastern half of Pendle, must not come last,' and 'We will keep this going and keep up the pressure on the authority to deliver,' he promised.
